nodes.bodyText:
Create variable for error_message so you don't repeat it.
Do you mean to continue if there's an error? I guess the other code will just fall through harmlessly?
No didn't mean to. Changing

I thought we discussed not allowing snapshotting if the images were parameterizable. Is that covered in another ticket?
Also, if there are errors in getting the images, this will fail silently and there will be no indication to the user. If there is an error, should we even allow snapshotting? Not sure...

It can be in another ticket. My understanding is CWL only accepts strings in a dockerPull so WDL is the one with parameterizeable images.
My thoughts on if there was an error getting an image was that it was okay to let the process continue. There may be cases where we miss docker refs entirely or are unable to properly parse it (like how wdl docker refs allow variables, doesn't seem easy for use to handle?).
But maybe we should indicate to the user we weren't able to process certain images.

LOG.error instead of info
Log the exception itself as well.
I don't think you need this if statement; if it's empty, you would just return the empty optional, which is what you want.
Question: Why this over TagApi.listRepoTagsWithHttpInfo()?
ahh, it looks like the swagger-java-quay-client stuff is all wrong
Yeah I didn't understand how to use it...
Would be worth a follow-up ticket to fix it (the quay.io swagger), this code is pretty hard to read/understand

Can use List<Map<String, String>>
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9852831/polymorphism-why-use-list-list-new-arraylist-instead-of-arraylist-list-n kind of idea
Can create once for the class since it doesn't change from method call to method call

Thought, this could be hooked up to a validation warning when we have it.
Further food for thought in #3216
Log the exception itself as well as a second parameter

Also, what can cause the IndexOutOfBoundsException? If it's on splitDocker, which on a quick skim of the code, I don't think it is, then you'll get an exception logging the exception.
Also, rather than using indexes, it would be nice to have a variable name, but not crucial.

I don't think it'd ever really happen if the call to quay was successful, but it could happen when splitting the manifest_digest to get the checksum on line 378. But now that you mention it, someone could put an incomplete quay URL and it could fail on 357.
Make an issue if it hasn't been done already
something something stream map collector to set
this doesn't need to be in the loop
took out
update comments in this function. probably rename function too
renamed

Extra line, don't know f it does anything. Does this test run this way?
Think it was like this before, but still.
yeah, still runs with the extra line, but removed it

Do this before a merge.
I would actually suggest https://github.com/dockstore-testing (in this case, I might be wrong but I don't think the test users need to own these workflows)
forked
You are not explicitly handling the case if it is not present. If that is intentional, could you add a comment? If unintentional, you should handle.
handled

You recalculate splitDocker and splitTag inside getImageResponseFromQuay when you already calculated them above on lines 357-358.
You're not going to used repo and tagName unless you get inside the if (response.isPresent()... statement below; I would move lines 366-367 to inside the if block, where you actually need/use them.
not exactly what you asked for but did change
